definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
frost/white powder or cream spread over a surface/frosting/(skin) cream

sentences.english: Treat them with a special hand cream.
sentences.chinese: 用特別的護手霜來呵護雙手。

sentences.english: This is probably my favorite hand cream.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是我最愛的護手霜了。

sentences.english: A very nourishing and non-greasy hand cream. Uses all natural ingredients from Southern Alps.
sentences.chinese: 一支非常幼滑滋潤而不油膩的護手霜。

sentences.english: Gradually, you can cultivate a habit of using moisturiser every time you wash your hands.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢的，你就會養成洗手後用護手霜的習慣。

sentences.english: A rich and indulgent hand cream, that helps to address the signs of ageing.
sentences.chinese: 這是一款豐厚滋養的護手霜，能減淡歲月的蹤跡。

sentences.english: This cream helps me keep the skin soft and not looking cracked.
sentences.chinese: 這是護手霜可以讓我的肌膚柔軟不皴裂。

sentences.english: After doing dishes or kitchen chores, I use Almond Milk.
sentences.chinese: 在洗過碗和做過廚房雜事之後，我用杏仁牛奶護手霜。

sentences.english: Rinse with cold water and apply any hand cream.
sentences.chinese: 最後用冷水洗乾淨並塗上護手霜就可以了。

sentences.english: Use hand lotion to keep your hair from getting too frizzy in the heat.
sentences.chinese: 將護手霜塗抹在頭髮上可防止其過於捲曲。

definition: to remove makeup/(old) to take off formal dress and ornaments
to (carry) on one's person/to (take) with one
